Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [cell phone rings] Hello, this is Dwight Schrute. [phone keeps ringing] Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [presses button on headset] Hello, this is Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hello? Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, we do have that. Hold on one second...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim, what are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And how many would you like?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Uh, uh, hang that up right now. Ha-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Absolutely. We can get that out to you immediately.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [into Jim's headset] This man is an imposter! Do not do business with him! This is not Dwight Schrute!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Dwight left his cell phone on his desk. So, naturally, I paired it to my headset.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [cell phone rings] K, fine. I'll just let it go to voicemail.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [presses button on headset] Hello, this is Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, is this Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes it is.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my goodness, you sound sexy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you. I've been working out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Woah, woah, woah, Pam!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Have you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam! You are not talking to Dwight right now. You are talking to Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No! [waves arms] Pam, I'm over here!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm confused...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Disconnect that right now. You give me your earpiece.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can't do that. Unsanitary.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ugh! Okay, you know what? Fine. I will reprogram my phone to go to my office phone. [presses buttons on his cell phone] Done.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [office phone rings at Jim's desk] This is Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, and I forwarded his desk phone to mine.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, hello Mater. Good news:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Today is Toby Flenderson's last day. I couldn't sleep last night. I came extra-early. So much energy... There are certain days you know you know you will remember for the rest of your life, and I just have a feeling that today is one of those days.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Morning.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mornin'. [to camera] So here we go, just a matter of hours now, until his horribleness has left the building. I'm going to set my watch alarm... And... [watch beeps]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Good morning, Kelly.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I can't believe this is your last day. How do you feel?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Fine. Good.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I feel weird.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: First thing on the agenda-actually, the only thing on the agenda, is the status of Toby's going away party.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: We have a buttercream cake and a slideshow of Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: But so far we only have two pictures of him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, well, this will not do. Toby is going away forever, and uh, we need to do something very very special. In some cultures, when somebody leaves, like New Orleans culture, they have a parade and they have a band and people party in the streets...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you mean, leaves as in dies? You want us to throw Toby a New Orleans' funeral?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If the Devil were to explode, and evil were gone forever, what sort of party would you have?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Like a beach blowout? Or a toga, toga-

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. You know-no!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Toga!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You always do this! We have a nice, modest party planned, and then you come in and demand the world. Let me be clear. There is simply no money for anything other than a cake and to develop a few more slides... although Toby won't be in them.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I thought that you might say that. [takes off his shoe; hums; takes out cash from shoe]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Every year, my sweet, sweet grandmother sends me a check on my birthday for fifty dollars. And lately, she has been sending me, like nine or ten checks a year... uh, as Nana starts to... but, I knew I should be saving it for something, I just didn't know what I should be saving it for. And then I had an awakening. "Michael, buy a motorcycle." So I put the money in my shoe, and then I forgot about it until now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I want a party that makes me feel like I am flying through the air without this... ugly weight holding me down, you know?... I want an antigravity machine. I saw it in a movie. You drink a potion, and then you just start floating all around.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So how much antigravity potion do you want?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No! No! You know what? This is not a party-planning committee anymore! And I don't want your foot money, and I feel uncomfortable participating.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Phyllis, can you do this?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [whispers] Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi, can I help you?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Hi. Yes, uh, I'm Holly Flax. I was told to ask for a Mr. Flenderson?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: As part of my last day I'm training the new Human Resources rep in the ways of the company. Again, the company has allotted for this training-one day.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: So this is H.R. This is your desk.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I love the view.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, it's great, isn't it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey. [kisses Jim on cheek]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey... What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Guess who just got into the Pratt School of Design.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No way! What did I say? I said that they'd love those sketches. Congratulations!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, thank you! I don't know why I doubted it, because I'm so clearly awesome!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes! So when do you start?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know, I didn't read it carefully, I just saw "congratulations" and I skimmed the list, I saw my name, I came in here to tell you and get a snack.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. Busy morning.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, you know it means I have to go to New York for three months...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's not a big deal. I'll come visit you. And you'll visit me. It's only two hours away. It'll be fine. That part's gonna suck, but it'll be great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, it sucks, but it'll be great.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: See how easy that is?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ohh... [they hug; she laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I wouldn't go if things weren't so solid with Jim. And down the road, if we have a family, I couldn't go then either. So, the timing's perfect... And that is the first time I've ever used the word "perfect" in here!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, Stanley...

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I want to introduce you to...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [watching from his office] Toby's replacement. Ugh. Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: So what do we know about her?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, we know that Toby thinks she'll be great. So, strike one, I hate her already.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I hate her too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why do you hate her?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Because she... stinks... with her... ways... and her... head.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, Dwight, sometimes... I don't know, I think you say things just to agree with me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Would that be such a bad thing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah! It would! Just have a thought. Have an original thought. Although, I will agree that her head is weird. You know what we need to do?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We need to sell her an elevator pass.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But our, our elevator doesn't require a pa... [gasps]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Exactly. A little old-fashioned hazing.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hi. Are there any local companies that rent antigravity machines?

Quote.Speaker: Woman over speakerphone
Quote.Text: Antigravity machines?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: That's right. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Woman over speakerphone
Quote.Text: What do they do exactly?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: They make you feel lighter...

Quote.Speaker: Woman over speakerphone
Quote.Text: Antigravity... Um... Anti...depressants? I could put you through to someone on that.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [knock on door] Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, do you still work here?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'd like to introduce you to my replacement.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nah.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Come on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. I think I will pass.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Michael Scott, this is Holly.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi. Yeah. Right. Okay, well, they hired a female Toby. Good for the world. Thank you, God, for creating two of you. Here's how things work here:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks to Toby, I have a very strong prejudice against Human Resources. I believe that the department is a breeding ground for monsters. What I failed to consider though, is that not all monsters are bad. Like E.T. Is Holly our extraterrestrial? Maybe. Or maybe she's just an awesome woman from this planet.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [shaking Holly's hand] The pleasure's all mine.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, thanks. I'm really looking forward to sitting down with you and finding out more about what you do here.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Any time.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: What do you do here?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: ...Excuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: What is wrong with this woman? She's asking about stuff that's nobody's business. "What do I do?"... Really, what do I do here? I should've written it down. "Qua" something, uh... qua... quar... quibo, qual...quir-quabity. Quabity assuance! No. No, no, no, no, but I'm getting close.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [whispering] Have you been introduced to Kevin?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: No. Which one's Kevin? [they glance over at Kevin subtly, who is stifling a giggle]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He's here on a special work program. He's slow, you know, in his brain.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh. Good for you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hazing is a fun way to show a new employee that she is not welcome or liked.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Accounting department, listen up. Holly, Human Resources. Angela, Oscar, and Kevin. [accountants mumble hellos]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Hello. Hello. [to Kevin] Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: What do you do?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I do the numbers.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, good for you.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Do you want a M&M?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, no, that is so sweet. But thank you though.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah. I keep them here at my desk so that everybody doesn't take them.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Well that is a very safe place for them.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here she is! Holly... You know, if we hung Holly from the ceiling, we'd have to kiss underneath of her. So-I know. Oh, sorry. Question, are you real, or are you a Hollygram?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh... [laughs along] Nice, I've never heard that one before actually.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I bet.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: That's good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I bet. Are these guys boring your ears off?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: No, no, I...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh... What, um, what is your commute like? How long does it take to get in?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Ooh, uh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, I should make you a mix. Do you have a, uh, a CD player?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Um... Y-yeah. Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you like it? It's a photo of everyone in the office. So you can take it to Costa Rica.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You're-you're not in it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well I was taking the picture.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I love it. I love it... I would love a picture of the two of us, to also take to Costa Rica.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure, do you have a camera here?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No, uh... [shouts] Does anyone have a camera here? [no one answers him] No one has a camera here. Uh...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm gonna... I'll go get one. Stay. [runs out of the office]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on the phone] So I just got the fax closing the sale, and uh, it's big. It is really big.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Congratulations!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Don't interrupt.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I just-

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Congratulations on doing your job. Did you enter the sale on the website?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I didn't. I just logged it in right here, so...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: All right, try to be a team player here, Jim. Log it in the website.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right, well it already went through, so...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Don't worry about that. Just re-log it. [hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [listening to "Crash Into Me" on his computer] Hmm... Jim? [Jim comes into his office] I am downloading some N3P...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's not it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Music...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: For a CD mix tape...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Close.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: For Holly.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And I'm looking for perfect songs that work on two levels.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are the two levels?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The two levels being, uh, "Welcome to Scranton"...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mmhmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And "I... love you."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Let's start with the "I love you" level.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, what's the group that was from Scranton that made it big? Was that U2?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes. You don't love Holly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I think I do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But you just met her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, it was love at first sight. Actually, it was-no, it was when I heard her voice. It was love at first see with my ears.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, okay, it doesn't work like that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, you're not a romantic.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Actually, I think I am. And I have a little bit of experience in office romance.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Like, with who?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We've been through this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, we are still dating. And guess what? I took it slow.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, you took it too slow.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, we're really happy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This thing with Holly feels a lot like love to me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And that's really sweet. And you can think that. But you don't say that out loud, and you definitely don't say it to her.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't want her to get away.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know. Here, Michael, you can court her as you get to know her, you know? I mean, the office is a great place for that. Pam and I, we got to know each other right out there. I mean, the first time we joked around was at my desk. And the first meal we ever had was, in the break room, actually. We were at two separate tables and, I remember that. The first time we kissed even, was right outside, and... Look, all I'm saying is that you can get to know someone really really well, like I did, right here at work.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I was thinking... fireworks for the party. What do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh boy. I appreciate your help, but I can't...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, no, no, no, no, no. I just meant I wanted to pay to have fireworks at the party.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Why would you do that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Because I'm gonna miss Toby. Yep, he's a heck of a guy, and I think we should send him off right. It doesn't matter. Here ya go. [hands her an envelope with money in it]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well we all want a good party, right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm going to propose tonight. Holy crap!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Hey Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Do you need some help?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I can't decide what to get.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Well, what do you like to eat?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well I like pretzels, but, I really like chips.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Hmm. Well how much money do you have there? [looks at the change in his hand] Okay, let's see... fifty... Oh, this is a button. Okay. Fifty-five, sixty-five, okay, you have seventy-five cents. So, that means you could get anything up in the top row.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hmm...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm totally gonna bang Holly! She is cute, and helpful, and she really seems into me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [on phone, leaving a message] Hey, Ryan, it's Jim. Look man, I don't know what's gotten into you lately, but you know what? I really don't care, because you're trying to get rid of me. And I bet you don't think I care enough about this job to actually fight back, but you're wrong, because I do, and I will. So you can keep trying to push me out of this place, but guess what? I'm not going anywhere. [hangs up and exhales sharply]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [tool clicking] Damn it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello, Holly. [Holly is on the floor with her desk chair in pieces] Woah, what are you doing? You don't, uh, you don't have to do that. I mean, we have already put-together chairs. That's how we buy them actually.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm trying to adjust the lumbar support on Toby's chair and... that made this up/down lever thing not work, and then I took the whole chair apart, and that... is the story of me on the floor. It's pretty good, right? You know, I'm gonna sell the movie rights.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And the sequel, "Woman Stands at Desk and Works." So, I have no idea how you, [he sits on the floor] how you sit like that.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yoga.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [as Yoda] Sit on floor and put together chair we will. [laughs nervously] Yo-da. Um...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [as Yoda] Pass curvy metal piece, you will.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So are you in down this weekend? Cause, I'm not-I'm not... I'm not gonna be in town. I'm going out of town.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Ohh, so you can't make my orgy? Kidding!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Kidding. [overdramatically] Acting!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [overdramatically] Acting!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [overdramatically] Acting!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [laughs] Lovitz.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I did it! [exhales]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What'd you do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I talked to her-Holly. Just pleasantries, nothing, you know... not like, do you want kids or, religion, or what side of the bed do you want. Hey, I can take either side of the bed at this point.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow. Okay, so how'd that feel?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It was hard. I wanted to kiss her.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm so glad you didn't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whew, oh God. [inhales] Laying a base. Laying a base...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: There you go. There's plenty of base-laying left, right?... Hey. Hey!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [giddy] Yeah...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hello Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Phyllis, you look like you're gonna have a heart attack.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Can I get a list of your vendors?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I shredded it.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Why would you do that?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Gosh, I just don't know. Why do you think?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [knocks files off desk] Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [Michael and Holly are still working on the chair] What'd you guys do?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, there he is. Thought you had gone home already. Why don't you go home, and come back for the party?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, we still have to do the exit interview.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes we do.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll let you in on a little secret:

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [Michael hands him a present] Wow, thanks, Michael, I...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Can I just say that, of all the idiots, in all the idiot villages, in all the idiot worlds, you stand alone, my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: [enters conference room] Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! Hi, good to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: You too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm just having a little exit interview.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know, that's why I'm here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, no, no, no. This is very boring stuff. Why don't you take a tour? Have you seen the baler?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: No, no, I'll look at it later. It's part of my job.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [enters conference room] Did you need me to take notes?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hi Pam. Stay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um... Alright, well then, I will proceed. [takes out note cards] I just have some questions that I was gonna ask. Um... Who do you think you are?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. Correct. Um... What gives-what-what gives you the right?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Um, I-I brought the binder. Do you wanna take a little look?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sure. You know what? That sounds good. I'll take a little look-see.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Here you go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you. [reads] What would you improve about Dunder Mifflin?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: This place, um...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, no no no no no...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I've got some ideas, I guess...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No no no no no. I'm not asking it. I'm just reading it out loud.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, I'd like to hear the answer.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well let me see... I would, uh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [hides his face from Holly; whispers to Toby] I'll kill you.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I guess everything's okay.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I made it this far, right? What's the point?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Toby, why don't you open your present?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, no no no, no, no. No, this-hey, hey, hey, hey, this might not be what I think... that I don't even know is in there, because there are a lot of presents in my car, and I don't know which is which...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [unwraps present; present is a rock with a Post-It note rubber-banded to it; reads] "Suck on this."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What the hell is that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's... What do you mean, "Michael"? That's not even my handwriting. [exits conference room] Hey! What the hell is going on here?! Who thought it would be hysterical to give Toby a rock for his going-away gift?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You did.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You made me wrap it. I thought it was over the line. I just- [Michael slams conference room door in his face]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, you know what that is? You know what that is? That is... a psyche. Psyche. So, that is not my real gift to Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So what is your gift?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My gift is forthcoming, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am going to give Toby...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Your watch?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...Yes, I am. That was it. How did you know that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I just knew.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: How did you know?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh that is so sweet.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well... That's my watch.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Thanks, I'm gonna set it to Costa Rica time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, that's good.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [from outside the conference room] Hey, it's the kid! Look, look, look, look, look! [Michael, Toby, Holly, and Pam exit the conference room] Hey! It's the temp! Look! [everyone is crowded around Jim's computer]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh my gosh.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: It's the temp! [all are watching a YouTube video of Ryan being escorted out of Dunder Mifflin corporate offices by policemen]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is that the police?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well this is what happened: uh, Ryan's big project was the website... which wasn't doing so well. So Ryan, to give the impression of sales, recorded them twice:

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [still watching video of Ryan] Oh my God. Ryan... Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I cannot wait to visit Ryan in prison. I'm gonna wear my hottest track suit, and get my hair done, and then be like, "Hi Ryan." And then all the other prisoners are gonna be like, "Damn! Ryan, you got a hot ex-girlfriend. Ooh, I would never have treated her so bad when I was outside of prison."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Would you do me a favor and connect me to Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Absolutely. [dials and hands Jim receiver]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [clears throat] Right to voicemail. [into phone] Hey, Ryan, it's Jim. You know what? Totally disregard that last voicemail, because you obviously have your hands tied. Good luck! [hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: What's protocol on this?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I normally do nothing, I guess. No, you shouldn't- [Holly knocks on Michael's door]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Michael, are you okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [voice straining] I'm just worried about my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, of course you are.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just, I'm fine. I'm holding it together. I-I have a business to run.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: No, hey.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm cool.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Stop. You can let yourself be upset. He's your friend. You know what I usually find?...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Holly is sweet and simple, like a lady baker. I would not be surprised to find out that she had worked in a bakery before coming here. She has that kind of warmth. I'm pretty sure she's baked on a professional level.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [everyone exits the building to find a carnival-themed party in the parking lot] Woah! Cool! A bouncy house!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Kevin, take your shoes off first!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No antigravity machine, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Sorry, Michael, I don't think they're real.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ferris wheel's pretty cool though.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow. Look at our parking lot.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, who'd have thought? [Pam sees fireworks being set up; smiles]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is Jim gonna propose tonight? He is, isn't he? No, he's not... Is he?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, it was a pretty good company, but I just couldn't see a future there. They kept hiring from the outside. It was easy to get in but impossible to rise up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's what she... a lot of places are like that.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I think it's really cool you hired Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You have it?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Almost. [she unlocks Holly's car]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, here we go. Here we go. [Mose carries a raccoon in a cage] Put it in. [he puts the raccoon in the car]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I like, uh...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: That-That's my car.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey. What are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Mose drops cage and runs] Mose!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What the hell is going on here?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: N-nothing you need to know the details of.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: There is a raccoon in the car, Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: N-no there's not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why did you do that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It was playful hazing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No. There is no such thing as playful hazing. Dwight, I want you to look at Holly right now. Everybody, I want you to look at Holly right now, and maybe if you look at her deeply enough, you will see what I see in her. And that is that we are all very lucky to have her here. Holly is the best thing that has happened to this company since World War II. Fifty years, she is the best. [to Dwight] Take care of that, all right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's not rabid.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Shh...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Thanks for bringing that up.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get it out. Come on, get it out. Get it out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm really sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Michael, thank you so much for saying that. [puts a hand on his arm] I feel so welcome here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I just... Um, excuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Did you see that! Did you see it? Did you see what... wow-wee! Uh, well, Jan didn't believe in showing affection, so... sometimes I don't know how to react when a girl touches me. Oh... I like it! [giggles]

Quote.Speaker: Vance Refrigeration guy
Quote.Text: Hey Mrs. Vance, we're all out!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hey, Kev, I need you to do me a solid and go buy some more barbeque sauce. [Kevin nods] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Cool! You drive your own car?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yup. This is my car. Do you drive your own car?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yep. Just like you.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Okay, bye.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Bye. Kevin, I'm really proud of you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on microphone] Alright! Let's hear it for Darryl and his band. [applause] You know what? Let's also give a shout-out to Phyllis for this awesome party, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [everyone applauds] Yay, Phyllis!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Probably the best one that we have ever had, right? [cheers and applause] But the real reason that we are here, is to say goodbye to a guy who we will probably never ever see again. Now, a lot of you know that I am an accomplished songwriter.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Song parody writer.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have done things like um, "Beers in Heaven."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Classic.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Or, "Total Eclipse of the Fart."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not my favorite, but...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I like that one.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's not my favorite...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I like that one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love to sing them, but I am not going to be doing that today. I am going to be doing something I wrote specifically for Toby. [to band] Do you know, um, "Goodbye Stranger"? Supertramp?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah. [music starts]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [sings] It was early morning yesterday... I was up before the dawn... and I really have enjoyed my stay... Toby must be movin' on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm gonna to miss Toby. He has a nice, calming presence in the office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing] Goodbye Toby, it's been nice. Hope you find your paradise...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Don't tell him I said this, but I always thought he was kinda cute.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [singing, screaming into the mic] Come tomorrow, feel no pain! Feel no pain! Toby! Toby! Tobee-yy! Toby's goin' away! See ya! He's outta here! See ya! He's outta here! Ohh! Goodbye Toby! Goodbye Toby! Goodbye Toby! Goodbye Tooo-by!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Not bad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, hey. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Someday I would love to hear "Beers in Heaven."

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, okay. Yeah. Well, actu-too soon. It's uh, it's uh, very sexual. [cell phone rings] Sorry. Kevin. [answers] Kevin, where are you? You missed my song, buddy.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, Michael, I'm at Gerrity's. You have to come down here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just pay for it and we'll reimburse you when you get back.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: No, I-I brought my money. Michael, there's something that you need to see.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Just hurry. [hangs up]

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Is he okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. He's at the supermarket and he needs me.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yeah well, the party, driving to the supermarket... it's a big day for him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, that's true. Don't move a muscle. I will be back momentarily, all right? [Holly freezes; Michael laughs] No, you can drink-you can finish your drink and then I'll-okay, I'll be back.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Well it was good to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: It was great to see you, Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yeah, so...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: O-kay. Hello Jan.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Hello... Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow, Kevin, really? We're- [to Jan] Sorry. We're in the middle of a party. [to Kevin] Is this why you called me down here?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, Michael, I just uh...

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I think you kids have a lot to catch up on.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks, Kevin. Um... [Kevin walks away, revealing Jan's pregnant belly]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow. I can't believe it! Look at you! [Jan laughs] Are you nauseous?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you-do you have cravings? You never touched my Propecea, or my Accutane, did you?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Uh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Good. Good. Thank God.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I didn't...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Cause that's...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: ... touch that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow, I am so happy. I am so deliriously happy...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Why?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because you're pregnant, and because it obviously happened when we were together. And, I am very...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yeah, it did...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ... proud.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: ... happen when...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: ... we were together. That's true. And-but, you... are not... uh, you're not the dad.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You cheated on me... when I specifically asked you not to?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: ...Not to. No, I did not. I did not cheat on you. I did not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, okay...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So it's mine, and it's not somebody else's, so... I know... the whole toilet seat thing is a myth, so...

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I went to a sperm bank.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You did?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Yuh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When we were going out?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Uh, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: W-I don't understand. You always used to be very cautious... I'd wear two condoms.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You'd rather have somebody else's sperm than my sperm?

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: No, no no... it's not just any sperm bank. I mean, it's really... this is a really, really great place. It's amazing, actually. I'm gonna bring you the catalogue. You should look through it. It's... and it's-in fact, it's right next to that little breakfast place that you like in the city where you can draw on the tables.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: IHop.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: IHop.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: If I was 22, and I had lots of time to have lots of children, then sure, let's let Michael have a shot at one of 'em. But, honestly, I need to make this one count.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Oh, that's really good. I feel so much better. I just needed to get all that out onto the table.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm glad you told me.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Look, I don't know what you're gonna be doing tomorrow, but I have my Lamaze class in Allentown, and um... you could come. I usually, you know, use a foam noodle instead of a partner...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, I'll... I have to think about it.

Quote.Speaker: Jan
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My whole life, I have known two things:

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh look, they're starting. [all watch fireworks display; scattered applause and cheers; Darryl's band plays soft music]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [to Phyllis] Well, I hope you had fun today, because you're never ever throwing a party again.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [gets engagement ring from his pocket] Hey...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [on microphone] Can I have your attention please? [music stops] I was waiting for the right time to do this, and I can't think of a better time than right now, with the music playing, and all our friends around, and fireworks going off... My parents are here! Andrew and Ellen Bernard. Thank you for sharing in this joyous moment. Miss Angela Martin, will you please join me onstage? [Angela shakes her head 'no'] Okay, then I will come to you, my flower. [knocks over Darryl's keyboard]

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Unh! Damn it!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Angela, will you do me the honor... of giving me your tiny hand in marriage? [shows her a ring]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: ...Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Into the mic, sweetie.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I said, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: She said yes! [light applause] And the crowd goes wild! Woo! [music starts playing; Jim puts his ring back in his pocket and exhales sharply]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I've been carrying that ring around in my wallet for six years. Because you don't know when you're gonna meet the right girl and the moment's gonna be right. And tonight, with the fireworks, and the music, and everything... it was right.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Can I be your bridesmaid?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well... it's my own fault.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Tuna! [hugs Jim; makes small explosion sound] I'm engaged!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know. That's awesome, man. That's great.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Mr. Andrew Bernard... it's got a nice ring to it.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey. Hey, you know, I just realized uh, I don't have a picture of the two of us.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah, um...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, could we...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure. Meredith, do you mind?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [hands Meredith his camera] This one right here.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Okay. One two three- [takes picture] Oh let's do it again. Pam your smile is weird.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's digital, so just take as many as you want.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: One, two three- [takes picture] One, two, three- [takes picture]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know, I just, I really thought Jim was gonna propose tonight...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Hey there.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: So you missed something really big.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yeah, Andy proposed to one of your accountants.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, wow.

Quote.Speaker: Holy
Quote.Text: I'm not so specific as I can be on my first day, but...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I can see Andy proposing to Angela. I can also see him proposing to Oscar. [they chuckle] Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: So... You know, somehow after all those ribs, I'm still really hungry. I don't know, I was thinking of maybe going off-campus somewhere, getting some dessert, or...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, um, well, you know what? You should go to the Glider Diner. Ask Stanley about that. Practically lives there.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'll go to the diner with you.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh that would be great.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, we can go eat pie.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: I love pie.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Me too.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Have a good night.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Okay. Good night.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Yeah, it was a good day. I mean, first days are always the hardest, right? Well, I should go. [Kevin is waiting in the car] I gotta buckle him in.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well this is it. I am here to see you off.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Thanks... [Hank is standing next to Michael] Really, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sorry. Corporate policy.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's not.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You might take something.

Quote.Speaker: Hank
Quote.Text: I don't think he's gonna take anything.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, security guard.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [watch that Michael gave him beeps] Oh, some kind of... alarm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on phone, leaving a message] Hi, Jan, it's Michael. I just um, I just want to let you know that I am going to go to your Lamaze class tomorrow. Um, and if there's any details you need to fill me in on, like... what exactly Lamaze is, that would be great. And I... will see you tomorrow morning. [hangs up] I am going to be... kind of a daddy.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Party planning's a real high. Like a runner's high. [gets out of elevator; hears moans and heavy breathing coming from office; opens door and sees Dwight and Angela making out]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [sees Phyllis; gasps] Oh my God!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? [turns and sees Phyllis; Phyllis gasps and drops the box in her hands]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: This is Jim Halpert...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: And Pam Beesly.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, Pam! Toby says such nice things about you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [to Toby] Thank you!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He didn't mention me, did he?

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, no, he said you were a really good salesman.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thanks, Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I've always gotten along well with Toby. Uh, we're friends. But I don't think we'll stay in touch necessarily. I think I'll probably get updates on him from Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, I think that makes us neighbors.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: It's a couple streets over.

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Oh, maybe you can show me some of the fun hangouts, and where to get my nails done.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Sure! That sounds fun!

Quote.Speaker: Holly
Quote.Text: Great.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I hate that bitch. I wanna cut her face. [Dwight walks by and hears]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stop! Don't look at me. On the counter you will find bread, peanut butter, and jelly. Pretend to make yourself a sandwich.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Pretend? Or really make one?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Really make one.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Make your own [bleep]in' sandwich.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Will you please? Make a sandwich. Now, according to my sources, you have an issue with the new H.R. woman. Well, so do I. And so does our secret benefactor. That's too much peanut butter. What I propose is a good old-fashioned hazing, and I need your help. If you choose to accept this mission...Wipe the knife off before you stick it in the jelly. Have you ever made a sandwich before? Dammit, Meredith!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [on phone] Well, who can do a party of this size? But you're in the business, you must surely know of some other businesses. Okay, well, I JUST WANT A DAMN DANCE FLOOR! Sorry. So sorry, I shouldn't have sworn, I'm so sorry. Um, thanks for your time. [knock on door] What? Sorry, I shouldn't have said 'what' like that, it was really rude.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Scared me. How's the party planning going?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Jim, I am so f[bleep]ed.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So it's going great, sounds like.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I don't know, I'm not used to the stress.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: When I was growing up, my mom said, "the sky's the limit." I could do anything. Be a teacher's aide, nurse's assistant, some kind of volunteer. But now, I, I'm not so sure.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: This is a picture I've been carrying around in my wallet for about six years. It's this unspoiled beach in Costa Rica, Playa Grande. Um, I take it out when I get stressed or depressed, and it really calms me down. Never thought I'd get to live here, you know. But it turns out they built these great new condos there, so, this could be me, right around, uh, where the trees used to be.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Did you just buy that?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah, I guess it will be my, uh, thing in Costa Rica, be a nature photographer.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's cool.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Yeah. Um, you mind if I get a picture?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Think you could...[wants to hand the camera to Jim, but Jim is starting to snuggle up with Pam, posing. Toby aims the camera, the flash pops up] Okay. [takes picture] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Good one? [Toby puts on the lens cover and scurries away awkwardly] That's a cool camera.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, this is the second time in two days that the website isn't working. Do you guys know anything about it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: The website is hiding, forming alliances with other sites, preparing an attack for which we will have no defense.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do you honestly believe that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, I do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm gonna get a second opinion.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It was down for a couple hours yesterday, then back up, and now I've heard from a very reliable source that it is once again out of commission. And that reliable source is you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, you could just say you don't know what's going on.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Um, I do, 'cause I just told you.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Is Ryan gonna fire me? I don't know. I know that I've done everything I can, and I just brought in a huge sale, and... am I insane, or was this kid a temp two years ago? Because in the three years that he's been here, I think all he's ever done is start a fire and grow a beard. And it's not even a good beard.

Quote.Speaker: Troy
Quote.Text: Troy Undercook, for Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ahh! I'm sorry, I didn't, I didn't see you come in.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Troy! What are you doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Troy
Quote.Text: Just filling in for Ryan, as a favor.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where is Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Troy
Quote.Text: He had an urgent matter in New York.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Welcome to our land.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight. [to Troy] Michael will be out in a second.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Can I get you a tankard of mead?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Troy, can you do me a huge favor? Next time you see Ryan, can you tell him to check his messages? That'd be great.

Quote.Speaker: Troy
Quote.Text: If I see him, I'll tell him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why wouldn't you see him? You work for him.

Quote.Speaker: Troy
Quote.Text: I report to Wallace now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, what's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Looks serious.

Quote.Speaker: Someone
Quote.Text: What's a...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, my God.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Troy, do you know anything about this?

Quote.Speaker: Troy
Quote.Text: Maybe I do.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Maybe I do. Enough of your magical riddles!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: And if the food stations are here and here... no! Here and here. Drinks here, then people can mingle. But then where would the band go?

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: Mmm. Well, what about there?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Mmm, no Bob, I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's times like these, I wish my mother were with me right now. She'd show me what to do. That's stupid; she's not here. [looks at watch] She's at water aerobics for the next forty-five minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Why don't we eat more corn dogs? They're delicious.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Totally, they're the best.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Corn dogs should be the standard. Corn dogs should be called hot dogs, and hot dogs should be called bad dogs.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Why don't we make corn burgers?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [chuckling] What a messed up world.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Seriously, do you like my idea? Corn burgers.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I need you to make an announcement that this party is a disaster.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: But I don't think it's a disaster. I think it's fun, and I like the food.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Deep fried Twinkies? It's gross!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Is that what that is?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know what, I didn't try those. [reaches for one] I could try this. Augh! Fried Twinkies, you kidding me? Starting to wonder about the food in this place [takes a bite]. Oh, God! That is so good.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: When I had my colitis, Toby was very helpful. He gave me seven weeks off. When I had my acid reflux, Toby was not as helpful. So I'm mixed on Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Toby Flenderson, come on up here.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Uh, no, that's okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on, no, no, no.

Quote.Speaker: Co-workers
Quote.Text: Toby! Come on, Toby!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Toby!

Quote.Speaker: Co-workers
Quote.Text: Toby! Toby! Toby!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Okay, okay, I'm going.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Toby has written a fantastic speech for you, he spent a year on it. It's very funny and charming and heartwarming. And it rhymes, and if it's not any good, he has instructed us all to storm the stage and beat him to a bloody pulp. [laughs] No! So, take it away, Toby! Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, uh, okay. Um. It's really great to be here tonight, with the Ferris wheel, the band, and the low sunlight. I'm gonna miss you all when I go to Costa Rica, and if I keep drinking beer like this, I'm gonna have to take a leak-a. [laughter from audience, Michael looks at camera unhappily] Look, on a more personal note, I just want to say thanks, you know, no matter what was going on in my life, you know, my divorce, or the custody battle, or that thing with my sister, it was just nice knowing I had a, a supportive place to come to where...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ach, [to Darryl quietly] okay, okay, play the cutoff music.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm gonna really miss going to beers with you guys every Tuesday night [Pam holds up soda in salute, Meredith yells 'yeah!', Michael looks at camera] and lastly, I'd love to urge you to keep up with my fight to have the building checked for radon gas. You know, it's a, it's a real serious matter, and every time I try to have the, uh...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Blah, blah, blah, blah...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: ...building looked into...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...blah, blah, overstaying your welcome! Let's keep it moving! Let's keep it moving! Toby, everybody!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I gave Toby my buddy Jorge's number in Costa. He'll hook Toby up with everything: cable TV, women, oh, and this amazing coffee to snort.
